info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 11:48AM EDT by NWS Burlington VT
info.description:
At 1146 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over North Hero, moving northeast at 30 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible.
Locations impacted include... Franklin, Wagner Point, North Hero State Park, Sheldon Junction, Alburg Tongue, Burton Island State Park, Butler Island, Ransoms Bay, Swanton Village, Kings Bay, Rock River Bay, Allens Bay In Grand Isle County, East Highgate, Martindale Point, Highgate Springs, Lazy Lady Island, Fee Fee Point, Holiday Point, Highgate Falls, and Knight Island State Park.
This includes Interstate 89 between mile markers 114 and 130.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
If on or near the northern portion of Lake Champlain, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
